page.title: 09Farming
page.content: This area has rich pasture and arable land which is mainly used for dairy cattle (Friesian Cows), some beef production and the growing of cereal crops. There are very few sheep today because the woollen industry began to decline over 100 years ago as man made fibres and the Commonwealth competed successfully. Very few people who live in our town work on the land as farming is now highly mechanised. There are however greater opportunities for agricultural engineers. We have a very successful mushroom farm in Bradford-on-Avon. The mushrooms are grown in the tunnels and chambers of worked out stone quarries. The mushrooms are seeded in compost derived from fermented stable manure imported from racing stables in the Newbury area.
